intro: Erythrospermum candidum, commonly known as the white-flowered erythrospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy, glandular leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Erythrospermum candidum is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
